result.execSummary:
The defendant Raequan S May was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:

- Restitution set at zero.

Consecutive to: Any other sentence with Day Reporting Center and Huber

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Raequan S May

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 4 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 49 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence with Day Reporting Center and Huber.

Court ordered no contact with the victim named in the complaint, or the location of the offense.

Court ordered the defendant pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision in case# 15CF3233.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.  Restitution set at zero.

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Raequan S May in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Defendant Raequan S May in custody.  Student Intern Daniel Murphy under the supervision of Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
The state has complied with victim notification.    Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court, defendant Raequan S May not in court, in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court via telephone, defendant Raequan S May not in court, in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense attorney is very ill and requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court, defendant Raequan S May not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant has pending felonies before Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defense would like to try and resolve this case with the pending felonies.  With the clerk's permission, Court ordered case transferred to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No reply from defendant or surety.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision to be monitored by drug testing.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Raequan S May in court with attorney James D. Rael.  Defendant Raequan S May in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court previously ordered a Bench Warrant on 07-28-2015. Court will continue the bench warrant.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($25.00) gj
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 25.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court earlier.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.  Defendant failing to appear and comply with JusticePoint, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.  Clerk was unable to contact attorney Patrick Wait to address violation.  Court ordered the defendant to appear on July 28, 2015 at 1:30 pm.  Clerk notified attorney Patrick Wait by text of the scheduled court date.

15RM032239  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07-05-2015

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Raymond U or KJ dob 8/24/97

Defendant Raequan S May in court with Student Intern Nicole Brandemuehl under the supervision of attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Raequan S May in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Raequan S May not in court.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 5/1/15 @ 1:30PM
